intro: Xysmalobium dealbatum, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Xysmalobium dealbatum is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
